title: Good computer for league?
body:
I want to build a gaming computer especially for league, but going cheap. Are these parts good?
-Xion Performance mATX USB 3.0 Tower Case
-EVGA 430 W1, 80+ WHITE 430W
-MSI AMD FM2+ A68H DDR3 SATA 6Gb/s USB 3.0 HDMI Micro ATX Motherboard
-AMD A8-7600 Quad-Core 3.1 GHz Socket FM2+ 65W Desktop Processor AMD Radeon R7
-Crucial 4GB Kit (2GBx2) DDR3-1600 MT/s (PC3-12800) Non-ECC UDIMM 240-Pin Desktop Memory 
-Western Digital Caviar Blue 320 GB Bulk/OEM Hard Drive 3.5 Inch, 8 MB Cache, 7200 RPM SATA II WD3200AAJS
 
Thank you for helping! (Don't worry about OS)

replies.body:
That's a pretty good budget setup for basic performance, and it certainly meets our [_system requirements_](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752654-Minimum-and-Recommended-System-Requirements/),  though there are some more optimizations that could be made to your specific configuration. I'd actually recommend reaching out on the [**BuildAPC Subreddit**](https://www.reddit.com/r/buildapc/) or the [**PcPartPicker Forums**](http://pcpartpicker.com/forums/), since those communities are very hardware-centric and could offer some great insight on some tweaks to build to consider.

Let me know if you have any questions.
Do you know any good OS i can get for cheap that is good with league (Just found out i can;t transfer my windows 10 to another computer)

We only support Windows and macOS, so it will likely have to be Windows. You can always ask the communities I linked above to see if there's another option for transferring your current Windows 10 license or another option we didn't think of yet.

What video card will it have? That is the biggest decision. Everything else, as long as you keep 2GB ram or greater (go 4GB though) and a CPU that is within the past 8 years, you are fine. Same with the video card. Anything since 2008-2010 is fine. League requires almost nothing to run. If you want to run on super high settings and super high resolution with crazy high fps, that is a different story. But, run of the mill gaming just get entry level and you are more than fine. Anything entry level in 2016 is 5-10x more than needed :).

EVGA GeForce 8400 GS 1024MB DDR3 PCI-E 2.0 Graphics Card DVI/HDMI/VGA 01G-P3-1302-LR 

Is this one good enough?(sorry first time building computer)

8400GS is pretty low quality. That is a 30$ video and will handle league (with some limitations on the settings), but isn't future proof at all and won't handle any serious games. Even if you aren't a serious gamer, I would go a little higher than that like 75-150$ minimum on a video card. What would I go with in your situation? I would go with the amd radeon rx 460. Best bang for the buck at around 100$. It is meant for esports. Are you building in a small case? This card would still work.
